entry.title: iwa: Do not use `kIsolatedWebApps` feature flag directly
entry.content:
This feature flag should almost never be used directly and instead

`content::IsolatedWebAppsPolicy::AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled` should be

used. In the renderer, the `switches::kEnableIsolatedWebAppsInRenderer`

command line flag should be used.



This CL replaces two uses:

- `apps_section.cc` used the feature flag but should use

`AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled`.

- `runtime_features.cc` uses both the feature flag and the command line

switch to enable Direct Sockets. Therefore, we can remove the

enablement based on the feature flag and instead make sure that the

command line switch is set properly in `ShellContentBrowserClient` so

that tests that set the feature flag continue to work.



Bug: b:289356220, 1481737

Change-Id: I61db6ae7414945d7455c43b43a1643fec45b52c8

entry.title: [ios] Consider a WebState dirty when shown
entry.content:
The last active timestamp is updated when the WebState is shown, so

mark the WebState as dirty in that case. This ensures that the data

is saved with the optimised session restoration code.

entry.title: sensors: Add support for virtual sensors in //services
entry.content:
Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JS2Wnyc9GiS_u1Ry3w4KsCyd51g8fm4RDEUcanZgzbM/edit?usp=sharing



This implements the concept of "virtual sensors" from the Automation

section of the Generic Sensor spec. From a spec perspective, virtual

sensors act like device sensors whose readings and properties are

controlled by users.



In Chromium, virtual sensors are represented by the

VirtualPlatformSensor class. There is a specific provider for them,

VirtualPlatformSensorProvider.



There is one VirtualPlatformSensorProvider instance per Mojo connection

that calls CreateVirtualSensor(), so that virtual sensors created in one

tab (not frame, and they persist across navigations) do not interfere

with other tabs (virtual sensors of the same type may be used with

completely different properties, constraints, and readings in different

pages and they should not affect each other).



On the //service side, SensorProviderImpl's `provider_` remains the same

and manages real sensors. The new `virtual_providers_` member maps a

mojo::ReceiverId to a VirtualPlatformSensorProvider.



On the //content side, WebContentsSensorProviderProxy is responsible for

invoking the Mojo operations on SensorProviderImpl. As before, it is not

accessible to Blink.



One consequence of this design is that fusion sensors will continue to

attempt to use only real sensors as sources, unless the fusion sensor

itself is created as a virtual sensor. Another consequence of this

design is that it is possible for real and virtual sensors of the same

type to coexist in the same page: real sensors are used as long as

CreateVirtualSensor() is not called; once that happens new sensors will

be virtual, but existing ones will not be affected.



Finally, the new code is tested by making GenericSensorServiceTest use

virtual sensors. GenericSensorServiceTest already tested the behavior of

the SensorImpl and SensorProviderImpl layer, so it is the ideal place to

start testing how SensorProviderImpl handles virtual sensors. It also

allows us to test a lot of VirtualPlatformSensorProvider directly.



This also helps with bug 1427302 now that usage of

FakePlatformSensor{Provider} usage has reduced considerably.



Bug: 1278377, 1427302

Change-Id: Iebe3e70bfe1d154e305243f876d9ae8b436757c9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4770863

Commit-Queue: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

Reviewed-by: Reilly Grant

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208711}

entry.title: [iOS][Fullscreen] Fix fullscreen when omnibox is above the keyboard
entry.content:
On some websites, updating the browser insets while the keyboard is

shown will dismiss the keyboard (crbug.com/1491165). Collapsing bottom

omnibox above the keyboard causes an update of browser insets. This

makes some textfield impossible to focus with bottom omnibox.



This CL adds a ForceFullscreenMode that is active when the bottom

omnibox is collapsed above the keyboard. When the mode is active:

- Forces fullscreen progress to 0 and prevents fullscreen exit.

- Disables browser insets update.

Exiting the mode will reset the fullscreen model to expand the toolbars.



Recording:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JdSUzT8CJz55YVCzyTYXzBRPDel83wpg/view?usp=drive_link



Bug: 1491400,1491165

Change-Id: Ie56bcae288873b352e13fd11b7e17da2c39f4897

entry.title: [text-autospace][text-spacing-trim] Support `text-spacing` shorthand
entry.content:
This patch supports the `text-spacing` shorthand[1], which is

for `text-autospace` and `text-spacing-trim`.



The `normal` and `none` preset values are supported, but the

`auto` isn't supported because it's not supported in

`text-autospace` and `text-spacing-trim` either.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#text-spacing-property



Bug: 1463890, 1463891

> >

> > The original background color was #FFA300, now it is changed to #FF8C00.

> > Note: #FF8C00 is close to #FFA300 and has a contrast ratio of 3:1.

> > Bug: 1352909

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4921770

entry.title: Allow custom OpenGL bindings to be defined
entry.content:
This PR adds the required modifications to the

opengl_es2_distortion_renderer.cc source file to allow the usage of

custom OpenGL bindings. Once the changes on said file have been

upstreamed, the overridden version of opengl_es2_distortion_renderer.cc

will no longer be needed.



Note: setting the OpenGL bindings only by wrapping the SDK main include

file (as done for OpenXR, see

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4457501) isn't

possible due to how the Cardboard SDK currently makes use of said

bindings for its own building process. Nonetheless, this change allows

SDK users to set the required bindings by setting a preprocessor

directive and including a new header file, instead of having to override

any internal SDK file.



- Using a Google Pixel 3 XL w/ Android 12

(google/crosshatch/crosshatch:12/SP1A.210812.016.C2/8618562:userdebug/dev-keys).



Tested:

entry.title: [text-autospace] change status to experimental
entry.content:
This CL changes "text-autospace"'s status to "experimental", so then

we can use it before we change the status to "stable" for integration

tests.



To changes the status, this CL:

- rebaselines css property tests: now they can recognize the

"text-autospace" property.

- rebaselines tests that have images as the expected results and are

mixing up ideograph and non-ideograph runs. for example,

text-combine-expected.png

- adds "text-autospace: no-autospace" to the following tests, as they

do not intend to test whether spacings are added.

- text-orientation-mixed-v(lr|rl)-100.html

- text-orientation-sideways-v(lr|rl)-100.html

- justify-vertical.html

- add "text-autospace: no-autospace" to the following tests, to bypass

some bugs around line breaker. They would be tracked by

https://crbug.com/1492030 and https://crbug.com/1492040

- line-break-8bit-after-16bit.html

- line-break-strict-012.xht

- InsertTextCommandTest.NoVisibleSelectionAfterDeletingSelection



A follow-up will clean up the virtual test suite and stale

TestExpectations.

entry.title: Show HTTPS padlock when BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled
entry.content:
Currently the HTTPS padlock in the address bar is often not appeared

when the BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled, or the feature is enabled

via Static Routing API. This is because of the lack of SSLInfo in the

response head.



Normally ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader sets the SSLInfo after

receiving the response from the fetch handler[1], which was discussed

there[2]. However, BestEffortServiceWorker doesn't run this code path if

the network request dispatched from the browser process wins, and the

URLLoader option of the race network request is

`network::mojom::kURLLoadOptionNone`, which doesn't involve the SSLInfo

to the response. It makes sense that BestEffortServiceWorker doesn't set

SSLInfo from the service worker main script because fetch handler may

not be involved, `kURLLoadOptionSendSSLInfoWithResponse` should be set

in the network request instead.



To use the same URLLoader option as the network request for the fallback

handling, this CL moves `GetURLLoaderOptions()` in

NavigationURLLoaderImpl to NavigationURLLoader, and make it static. And

ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader calls it.



This approach adds `kURLLoadOptionSniffMimeType` to the option, but I

believe this doesn't matter since that option is already used other

navigation requests called through

`NavigationURLLoaderImpl::FallbackToNonInterceptedRequest`.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/service_worker/service_worker_main_resource_loader.cc;l=849-856;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=main_resource_loader&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[2] crbug.com/392409



Bug: 1491332

Change-Id: Id8ebafae6464f10510dace392461bdb5eba4f4d0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4924714

Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

glyph-width features.

entry.title: Avoid usage of C++'s thread_local in SamplingHeapProfiler
entry.content:
Clang's implementation of C++'s thread_local storage uses emutls on

Android. Emutls again is built upon pthread's thread local storage which

may allocate if not initialized early in startup process.



This CL changes thread local storage of the SamplingHeapProfiler to the

same approach used in the PoissonAllocationSampler, ensuring early

initialization and thus preventing (re)allocations.



Bug: 1475165

Change-Id: I328076d70264cca1fd0ccde365c1baa23c2ff1da

entry.title: [Office upload] Add CloudProvider histogram
entry.content:
Add the (existing) CloudProvider enum to enums.xml so it can be logged

in the new FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.CloudProvider histogram. Also

extend CloudProvider to include None and Unknown values.



It records the Google Drive or OneDrive cloud provider for a file being

opened with Drive web or the Microsoft 365 PWA, respectively.



Update DriveTest and OneDriveTest tests to check this metric is logged

in ExecuteFileTask().



The new metric can also track the number of CloudOpenMetrics objects

created as it is logged at the same time.

entry.title: Reland "os_languages_page: Add polling for input method language pack status"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 08a37a587a21efcd8475794352925703f2209e73.



Reason for revert: Reland with fix for test flakes (test failures should

now be consistent) and failing tests.



Original change's description:

> Revert "os_languages_page: Add polling for input method language pack status"

>

> This reverts commit a877d3c506108f717e2bc68f1a5843eb7ba3cd72.

>

> Reason for revert: Introduced test flakes (https://crbug.com/1491677)

>

> Original change's description:

> > os_languages_page: Add polling for input method language pack status

> >

> > The polling will be deprecated in a future CL using an observer / event

> > based API. However, the API to get the status of a language pack will

> > still be necessary to get the initial status of a given input method.

> >

> > If we had a synchronous cache of language pack statuses which is

> > returned through extension API calls, _as well as_ an observer / event

> > based API, the API to get the status of a language pack would be unused

> > by language / input settings.

> >

> > Bug: b:298128915

> > Change-Id: Ic82d33bbfa9e0748b753940b8f210b1bb4e12eb6

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4896044

> > Commit-Queue: Claudio M

> > Auto-Submit: Michael Cui

>

entry.title: WebNN: Refactor Conv2d, Clamp, Relu, Softmax definition in mojo.
entry.content:
Define the struct `Conv2d` with the input, filter, output operand id

and the attributes moved from `Conv2dAttributes`.

Define the struct `Clamp` with input and output operand id and the

attributes flatten from `ClampAttributes`.

Define the `Relu` to compute the rectified linear function of the

input tensor, the `Softmax` to compute the softmax values of the 2-D

input tensor.

entry.title: [iOS] Ignore OfficeImportErrorDomain errors
entry.content:
Chrome's error handling relies on injecting JavaScript to replace the

webpage contents. Unfortunately, this does not work when the web view

encounters OfficeImportErrorDomain errors. However, the web view already

displays this error to the user. By ignoring the error, Chrome's error

logic will not attempt (and fail) to inject its own error page and the

webView's error will remain displayed.



Fixed: 1489167

Change-Id: Id5611668415fa2bc0b67cd0f36273d7fc41c9df1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4932685

Reviewed-by: Ali Juma

entry.title: Enable CompressionDictionaryTransportBackend by default

entry.title: Account for async mouse event dispatch in back navigation prerender test
entry.content:
It's possible for SimulateMouseEvent to dispatch the event

asynchronously. This could cause us to perform the back navigation before

eligibility of the prerender is determined. This doesn't affect the

metrics reporting, but it would become a source of flakiness once we

start triggering an actual prerender attempt.



Technically we only need to wait for event dispatch, not the

acknowledgement, but we await the ack here to make use of existing test

utilities.



Bug: 1422266

Original change's description:

> [What's New] Allow Refresh What's New to show in latest milestone

>

> Rollout for Chrome Refresh has been extended to M119. In this version,

> there is also a dedicated milestone-based WNP, so both pages need to be

entry.title: Consistently use is_initial_empty_document() for WebUI initial RFH reuse.
entry.content:
This is a followup fix to https://crrev.com/c/4726542. In that CL,

there was a mismatch where the eligibility check for RenderFrameHost

reuse used has_committed_any_navigation(), but the updated WebUI

bindings check in RFHI::AllowBindings() used

is_initial_empty_document(). These differ in a couple of ways: e.g.,

has_committed_any_navigation() gets reset after crashes, and

is_initial_empty_document() may also become false after

document.open(). As one consequence, this meant that explicitly

navigating to about:blank, then crashing the blank process, and then

navigating to a WebUI page led to trying to still reuse the

about:blank's SiteInstance and process (because

has_committed_any_navigation() had been true but was reset), but then

the WebUI bindings check preventing bindings from being granted for

that navigation because it found a RFH in that process for which

is_initial_empty_document was false (namely, the crashed about:blank

RFH).



This CL updates the initial RFH reuse check to also use

is_initial_empty_document(). This is the stronger check which will

both avoid potential reuse after crashes and also if the initial empty

document happened to be somehow altered by document.open().



Bug: 1485586

Change-Id: I6f4f5eae5e654698abb8ca0e2c64b1ae6e1cacc6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4932625

Commit-Queue: Charlie Reis

Reviewed-by: Charlie Reis

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1208613}

entry.title: Revert "Fix warning on needs_gomacc_path_arg."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4927c23d72f726d4dfe67aed92ef379aa6d71422.



Reason for revert:

Broke step generate_build_files on lacros-arm32-dcheck



First failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/lacros-arm32-dcheck/5153/overview



Bug: 1491999



Original change's description:

> Fix warning on needs_gomacc_path_arg.

>

> ChromeOS builds give the GN warning:

>

> Build argument has no effect.

> toolchain_args.needs_gomacc_path_arg = false

> ^----

> The variable "needs_gomacc_path_arg" was set as a build argument

> but never appeared in a declare_args() block in any buildfile.

>

> The variable needs_gomacc_path_arg is an argument to the toolchain

> template, and isn't a build argument. It was added here:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2052218

> and there was never a declare_args block with this variable.

>

> This change converts this parameter to a normal template parameter

> rather than a member of the toolchain_args dictionary.

>

> There should be no behavior change.

>

> Change-Id: Ia2c420d47f11077315d18ab722831655d07fefa4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903233

> os_languages_page: Add polling for input method language pack status

entry.title: Roll src/third_party/sqlite/src/ b7e480172..2e9db942a (585 commits)
entry.content:
**Also update the SQLite roll instructions.**



https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/deps/sqlite.git/+log/b7e480172bb2..2e9db942a540



$ git log b7e480172..2e9db942a --date=short --no-merges --format='%ad %ae %s'

2023-10-11 estade Amalgamations for release 3.43.2

2023-10-10 Version 3.43.2

2023-10-09 Use snprintf() in place of sprintf() in a debugging function in the CLI.

2023-10-09 Add a TCL script that does various verification checks on the source tree to make sure that generated code has been updated correctly.

2023-10-09 Change the TEA version number to 3.43.2 also.

2023-10-09 Update the version number to 3.43.2.

2023-10-09 Fix a potential UAF caused by JSON parser cache spill.

2023-10-07 Fix a resource leak: sqlite3_blob_reopen() was failing to invoke the xDel() distructor on a register when it sets that register to the new rowid.

2023-10-05 Improved detection of corrupt databases in balance_nonroot(). dbsqlfuzz d1cf013c50a620b68c2a5bd240d29afd65e5f58e.

2023-09-30 stephan Correct an undefined-value deref in the JS bindings, triggered by passing invalid args and then tripping over an undefined value while trying to report that. Reported in [forum:dd42df144651d779|forum post dd42df144651d779].

2023-09-15 Do not try to convert a double into an unsigned 64-bit integer, as that does not work on all platforms. A double can only be converted into a signed 64-bit integer.

2023-09-12 Fix a use-after-free error in fts5 that could occur when querying the "rank" column immediately after another connection changes its definition.

2023-09-11 Remove a harmlessly unused variable from FTS5.

2023-09-11 Refuse to build amalgamation-tarball and snapshot-tarball if the TEA version number disagrees with ./VERSION.

2023-09-11 Fix the TEA version number to be 3.43.1

2023-09-11 Version 3.43.1

2023-09-08 Fix a problem with fts5 secure-delete mode causing fts5 to corrupt its records.

2023-09-07 Fix a bad assert() in FTS3.

2023-09-07 Fix a buffer overread in the sessions extension that could occur when processing a corrupt changeset.

2023-09-07 Version number to 3.43.1.

2023-09-01 stephan In the OPFS VFS' importDb() methods, overwrite the header bytes 18 and 19 with 1 instead of 0. Correct a potentially leaked/unclosed SharedAccessHandle when importDb() throws.

2023-08-31 Do not disable unused columns in a UNION ALL sub-query if any component of the sub-query is DISTINCT.

2023-08-30 Fix a bug in json_array_length() introduced in version 3.43.0 If the JSON input comes from json_remove(), the removed array entries are still counted as part of the array length.

2023-08-30 Fix the AVG() and TOTAL() functions so that they work with infinitites.

2023-08-28 Fix an issue with infinity handling by the SUM() function that goes back to the extended-precision SUM() enhancement of check-in c63e26e705f5e967. Problem reported by forum post 1c06ddcacc86032a.

2023-08-28 stephan Resolve a makefile bug which causes sqlite3-worker1-bundler-friendly.mjs to be built incorrectly. Reported in [forum:a874e435cf4690c1|forum post a874e435cf4690c1].

2023-08-24 Version 3.43.0

2023-08-24 Dan Kennedy Change a variable name in fts5FlushOneHash() to avoid shadowing another.

2023-08-23 Fix typo in the Lemon documentation.

2023-08-23 More changes to documents for GitHub-style markdown.

2023-08-23 Fix the Markdown in the compile-for-windows.md document so that it works on GitHub. Improved header text in README.md.

2023-08-23 Minor adjustments to the wording about pull requests in the README.md file.

2023-08-23 The pageOnDirtyList() assertion is too slow even for debugging builds, for some corner cases. It makes the query appear to hang. So make it an EXPENSIVE_ASSERT instead.

2023-08-22 Fix a harmless memory leak in the sqldiff utility.

2023-08-22 Dan Kennedy Add makefile target "sdevtest" - like "mdevtest" except asan and usan enabled for the non-debug test.

2023-08-22 Dan Kennedy Update version number in autoconf/tea/configure.ac.

2023-08-22 Dan Kennedy Update autoconf/Makefile.msc (by running mkmsvcmin.tcl) to support the "ASAN=1" option.

2023-08-21 Dan Kennedy Fix an undefined integer overflow in fts5.

2023-08-21 ifdef adjustments so that SQLITE_OMIT_WAL works with SQLITE_USE_SEH.

2023-08-21 Fix another UBSAN inaccuracy in fuzzcheck.

2023-08-21 Address minor inaccuracies in fuzzcheck and RTREE found by UBSAN.

2023-08-19 stephan shell.c.in help text typo fix. No functional changes.

2023-08-18 Rename the decimal_sci() function to decimal_exp(). [forum:/forumpost/fa027bb0ab|Forum post fa027bb0ab].

2023-08-18 Dan Kennedy Avoid running test case sort2.2.3 under address-sanitizer. It runs out of memory on some 32-bit platforms.

2023-08-18 Enhance the CLI and the fuzzcheck utility programs to report whether they are compiled as 32-bit or 64-bit for things like the --version option.

2023-08-18 Enhance the notes on compiling for Windows11 to explain how to do 32-bit builds on a 64-bit system.

2023-08-17 Do not allow bound parameters in the ON CONFLICT clause of an UPSERT. dbsqlfuzz 9983e2c77634a8ccf33b5c91fa9982599de5f9e9

2023-08-17 Dan Kennedy Fix an error in documentation comments in fts5.h.

2023-08-17 Dan Kennedy Add extra test to fts5synonym2.test.

2023-08-17 Dan Kennedy Add "Windows-Sanitize" configuration to "testrunner.tcl release" tests on windows.

(...)

2023-05-31 Dan Kennedy Fix a problem causing an infinite loop in the recovery extension when processing a corrupt free-block list.

2023-05-30 Simplifications to the new timediff() logic.

2023-05-30 stephan Minor tweak to the OPFS async proxy to attempt to account for a spurious high-load console error message which was reported via the sqlite-wasm npm project.

2023-05-30 stephan Minor internal JS doc fix. No code changes.

2023-05-30 New test cases for the timediff enhancements.

2023-05-30 All date/time modifiers of the form (+/-)YYYY-MM-DD without the following HH:MM:SS.SSS.

2023-05-30 Problems fixed. All tests are passing now.

2023-05-30 Improvements to the timediff() function. Test cases added. Not all test cases are passing.

2023-05-29 New date/time modifier: (+|-)YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM(:SS.SSS)?

2023-05-29 Prototype implementation of a proposed "timediff(X,Y)" SQL function.

2023-05-27 Fix an issue with sqldiff reported by [forum:/info/9bd2155bdfae25a7|forum post 9bd2155bdfae25a7].

2023-05-27 Dan Kennedy Add extra tests for fts5, large rowids and "ORDER BY rowid DESC". No changes to code.

2023-05-25 stephan Add ability for the JS Worker1.exec() API to report the number of changes made to the caller, per request in [forum:d0b19483642e20dd | forum post d0b19483642e20dd].

2023-05-23 stephan Minor cleanups in demo JS code, per forum feedback.

2023-05-23 Dan Kennedy Avoid performing aggregate processing more than once for a single expression. [forum:/info/36ff78b2a3|Forum post 36ff78b2a3].

2023-05-23 When converting an aggregate expression to AGG_COLUMN, be sure to remove the EP_Unlikely flag if it is present. [forum:/info/fbfe330a2009d036|Forum post fbfe330a2009d036].

2023-05-23 Dan Kennedy Fix a buffer overread in the recovery extension that might occur on 32-bit platforms.

2023-05-23 Dan Kennedy Add test cases for the recovery extension. No changes to code.

2023-05-22 larrybr Avoid duplicate WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN #define. Fix a trivial nit likely never observed.

2023-05-22 When a floating-point RTREE is presented with large integer constraints - integers that are too big to be represented exactly by a float - then take extra steps to ensure that all possibly relevant entries in the RTREE are returned, even in boundary cases. Fix for the problem identified by [forum:/forumpost/da70ee0d0d|forum post da70ee0d0d].

2023-05-22 Dan Kennedy Fix a buffer overrun that could occur in fts5 when processing corrupt records.

2023-05-19 stephan Extend detection of the INSERT...RETURNING locking case to the DB.selectValue(s)/selectArray/selectObject() family of functions. Add tests for INSERT/UPDATE...RETURNING with those functions.

2023-05-19 stephan Minor doc typo fix.

2023-05-19 stephan oo1.Stmt.finalize() no longer throws, but instead returns the same as the C API. oo1.DB.exec() now triggers the INSERT...RETURNING locking failure as an exception via reset() instead of finalize(). Some code-adjacent internal API renaming for clarity's sake.

2023-05-19 Improved documentation for sqlite3_reset(), in response to [forum:/forumpost/a72bab3dea|forum post a72bab3dea].

2023-05-19 stephan sqlite3.oo1.Stmt.reset() now throws if sqlite3_reset() returns non-zero, analog to [f23eb5c6d365].

2023-05-19 stephan Add a basic INSERT RETURNING test for the oo1.DB.exec() API.

2023-05-19 stephan sqlite3.oo1.Stmt.finalize() now throws if sqlite3_finalize() returns non-zero. This is intended to address the INSERT RETURNING case covered in [forum:36f7a2e7494897df|forum post 36f7a2e7494897df].

2023-05-19 stephan Correct typo in an 'extern' decl name, reported in [forum:1d4342156439233b|forum post 1d4342156439233b].

2023-05-19 Change the RTREE engine so that equality comparisons of floating point values are duplicated in the byte-code so that the comparisons are done using 64-bit floats and consistent results are always obtained. [forum:/forumpost/da61c4a1b5b4af19|Forum post da61c4a1b5b4af19].

2023-05-18 Fix incorrect b-tree root page reports from the enhanced PRAGMA integrity_check output introduced in version 3.42.0.

2023-05-17 Fast-path the btree transaction start for the common case where a transaction is already active.

2023-05-17 Simplification, performance improvement, and size reduction in the codeAllEqualityTerms() function of the code generator.

2023-05-17 New assert() statements to verify that Expr.iColumn is never used as an array index when its value is negative.

2023-05-17 Improved assertions on substExpr().

2023-05-17 Dan Kennedy Avoid an assert() failure that could occur in SQLITE_ENABLE_UPDATE_DELETE_LIMIT builds when a WITH clause attached to an UPDATE or DELETE statement created a CTE of the same name as the table being modified.

2023-05-17 Fix two assert() statements that failed to take into account the likely() built-in function. This does not impact production code.

entry.title: Avoid raw_ptr<> arithmetic in base::raw_span<>::begin() and end().
entry.content:
Under the BackupRefPtrScheme, raw_ptr<> arithmetic can be slow since

it must check for a pointer going beyond the end of a slot. This is

generally avoided by base::span<>, but one remaining usage is when

constructing an iterator. We can get marginally more efficient code

for raw_span<> by first converting to T*, and trusting that the span

is performing the appropriate bounds checks.



Change-Id: Id48be30fb03d12754ddfa553a8ff0ec1f5cb81e7

entry.title: Fix warning on needs_gomacc_path_arg.
entry.content:
ChromeOS builds give the GN warning:



Build argument has no effect.

toolchain_args.needs_gomacc_path_arg = false

^----

The variable "needs_gomacc_path_arg" was set as a build argument

but never appeared in a declare_args() block in any buildfile.



The variable needs_gomacc_path_arg is an argument to the toolchain

template, and isn't a build argument. It was added here:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2052218

and there was never a declare_args block with this variable.



This change converts this parameter to a normal template parameter

rather than a member of the toolchain_args dictionary.



There should be no behavior change.



Change-Id: Ia2c420d47f11077315d18ab722831655d07fefa4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903233

Commit-Queue: Brett Wilson

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 048603b3375064d2f34773bea1eb796882068848



Original change's description:

> Reland "Update Chromium to use VMA 3.0"

>

> This is a reland of commit 39d7f0daabd13c913865b2a583d6da21d77a5f70

>

> An uninitialized value was causing errors in MSAN tests.

> * Initialized the value of the VmaVulkanFunctions in CreateAllocator()

> to {}.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Update Chromium to use VMA 3.0

> >

> > Following the change in ANGLE to add support for VMA 3.0, we must

> > also update the VMA version used in Chromium. Currently ANGLE supports

> > both VMA 2.3 and 3.0, via setting ANGLE_VMA_VERSION which is defined

> > based on the build files. In Chromium, since this parameter is not set,

> > ANGLE defaults to using VMA 2.3, which results in conflict if only the

> > VMA hash is changed.

> > * ANGLE CL: https://crrev.com/c/4777337

> >

> > * Updated the VMA hash in the dependencies to the 3.0 version.

> > * Updated the usage of some functions and variables in gpu/vulkan/ to

> > be in line with the new VMA changes.

> > * Added angle_vma_version to the build files. It is set to allow ANGLE

> > to use VMA 3.0.

> > * This parameter is added temporarily. When ANGLE removes support for

> > VMA 2.3, it can be removed.

> >

> > Bug: b/295208838

entry.title: Make DataSourceFactory::CreateDataSource async
entry.content:
Looks like the rawptr access to url_data_ that was passed from

WebMediaPlayerImpl to MultibufferDataSourceProvider wasn't safe because

the ownership model:



DemuxerManager owns

ManifestDemuxer owns

HlsManifestDemuxerEngine owns

SequenceBound owns

MultiBufferDataSourceFactory



and DemuxerManager outlives WebMediaPlayerImpl and MediaFactory, where

MediaFactory owns the unique_ptr which

MultiBufferDataSourceFactory's raw_ptr points to.



This can be mitigated by making CreateDataSource async, allowing the use

of weak_ptr references to WMPI to only talk to `url_index_` while it is

still allocated. This also nicely gets rid of the need to store

additional members in MultiBufferDataSourceFactory.



R=dalecurtis



Bug: 1490884

entry.title: pip-pinch: Fix window freeze for additional mid-pinch finger
entry.content:
When the third finger is placed on a client PiP window during

pinch-to-resize, the finger is registered with a different

`touch_event_id` from the original pinch gesture and therefore the event

is not correctly transferred from `ExoSurface` to `ExoShellSurface`.

This causes the `gesture_target_` to be incorrectly updated, resulting

in undefined behavior such as window bounds jumping and window becoming

immovable. This problem also occurs with 4 or more fingers.



This commit introduces two fixes to resolve this issue:



1. The code block that updates the `gesture_target_` value was moved to

after the `if` statement that checks that the current event's gesture

target matches the gesture's starting target.



2. When an event that has a different target than the gesture's starting

target is received, not only is the event ignored but the gesture is

ended. This is to make sure that `ToplevelWindowEventHandler` handles

one target throughout one gesture.



Bug: b/301045554

Test: added unittest; manually verified that additional mid-pinch finger

ends gesture



Change-Id: I5e66100a4c1a0a5832a36b0ef3d833b5c219fe10

entry.title: Fix renderer content settings (part 3 / N)
entry.content:
This CL introduces all of the plumbing for the an upcoming refactor

without hooking up the business logic on either end. This will allow for

simpler reviews of the business logic and associated tests.



This CL introduces a new mojom RendererContentSettings which is a member

of CommitNavigationParams. This mojom will contain pre-computed content

settings from the browser process on a per document basis.



The default values for this mojom come from the current implementation

of ContentSettingsAgentImpl and callsites. For example, the only

callsite to AllowPopupsAndRedirects sets a default value inline:

```

settings_client->AllowPopupsAndRedirects(false /* default_value*/)

```



Low-Coverage-Reason: Tests added in a subsequent CL.

entry.title: Stop assigning damage to quads with non integer AA transforms
entry.content:
Previously this logic lived in OverlayCandidateFactory, but this

resulted in damage being dropped from the quad and the root surface and

getting lost.



Move this logic to SurfaceAggregator to fix this bug.

entry.title: Adjust style of Compose suggestion.
entry.content:
The mocks for the Compose suggestion have a different style than

normal Autofill popup entries. This CL makes these adjustments. The

mocks are linked in the bug for this CL.



On top of that, it changes the type of the main label button to enable

a "NEW" badge. The control for when to show the "NEW" badge will be

connected to the in-product-help system in a follow-up CL.

entry.title: Fix resolving of 'auto' for background-size
entry.content:
BackgroundImageGeometry::CalculateFillTileSize() was not distinguishing

between "natural ratio" and "natural size" properly, and would thus

compute incorrect tile sizes in certain cases.



Reimplement the background (tile) sizing step to better follow the

letter of the spec[1] using the new function GetNaturalSizingInfo()

on StyleImage.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-backgrounds/#background-size
